result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Lee Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing May 12, 2016.
**** 7-14-2016, Judge Sanders; Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,500.00 payable to Ed M. and Court ordered restitution in the amount of $475.00 payable to Justice Point, Inc. Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.  Restitution to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges, and/or fines.  Failure to pay by the end of supervision will result in civil judgment.****

Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so.
Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges. 
DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance during the term of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
No Contact Order with Charles W.
No Violent Contact with defendant's mother.  No contact without the mother and agent's approval.

Court recommends Supervision by the Mental Health Unit.
An updated mental health evaluation. Comply with any recommended treatment.
Take all prescribed medications.
Work with the Literacy Program.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.  **5/9/2016 Honorable Mark A. Sanders.  Credit of 361 days.  Order signed.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing 04-14-16 received and filed. (28 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION.

Attorney Calvin R Malone in court, defendant Anthony Lee Coleman not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,500.00 payable to Ed M. and Court ordered restitution in the amount of $475.00 payable to Justice Point, Inc. Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.  Restitution to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges, and/or fines.  Failure to pay by the end of supervision will result in civil judgment.

DOC request to review sentence credit on count four.
Count one.
Count four.
Restitution hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Lee Coleman in court with Attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Anthony Lee Coleman in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeds.  No corrections/Corrections made to the presentence investigation report.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant. 

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  54 months with  361 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  18 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  36 months.  

As to Count 4:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Count 1.  

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  Court recommends supervision by the Mental Health unit
-  an updated Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment/therapy
-  Take all prescribed medications
-  Work with the Literacy program
-  Restitution to be determined at restitution hearing
-  No Contact Order with Charles W.
-  No Violent Contact with defendant's mother - no contact without the mother and agent's approval
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Anthony Lee Coleman in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Anthony Lee Coleman in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 28.  Pursuant to negotiations, Counts 2 & 3 are DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Counts 1 & 4: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Received and filed: Ineligible Voting Notice.  Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Court GRANTS defense motion to be present for PSI interview.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel requests new date.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 28.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Lee Coleman in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Anthony Lee Coleman in custody.  Michael White, student intern under the supervision of Ronald Dague for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  (Scheduling date verified with Deputy Court Clerk Satterwhite.) Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return.  Hearing proceeded.  Parties in receipt of report authored by Dr. Mary Kay Luzi finding the defendant competent to proceed.  There being no challenge to the report dated 4-10-15 by the state, defense counsel or defendant, the court found the defendant competent to proceed and ordered the proceedings reinstated.  Bail arguments made by the state and defense.  The Court orders cash bail to remain at $1500.00 CASH BAIL with same terms and conditions (bail amount when proceedings were suspended).  Case to return to preliminary hearing court at this time.
